issue.title: Include Abstention vote for referenda in referenda tab (vote button) - OpenGov
issue.body:
With v9340 runtime upgrade, abstention vote was included: this allows token holders to note they see the proposal, and do not care to cast a vote in favour or against, **BUT the voting power is included on Support calculation** (good for curves thresholds) - it would be good to add this to the voting UI. 

https://hackmd.io/@otar/SykAgWmOo

issue.title: Remove persistent background pages (basically eol in Chrome)
issue.body:
Specifically https://github.com/polkadot-js/extension/blob/master/packages/extension/manifest.json#L11

This puts the extension down the road to get ready for a move to V3 manifests (persistent not supported, background pages are service workers)

There is an impact on initialization, so will see what the overhead turns out to be. (Specifically wasm-crypto)

This also means that the in-memory state needs to be moved to actual storage as applicable.

The checklist -

https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/mv3-migration-checklist/

comment.body:
Have a working local version that I've been using and sorting through issues (of which there were "some", not even mentioning dual FF & Chrome support), but there also seems some breathing room atm - https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33925735. Keeping an eye since it may just be enough tracking the FF rollouts of support.

TL;DR Some breathing room is nice since FF + Chrome compat is "slightly" nightmarish...

issue.title: Unavailable chain endpoints
issue.body:
cc @polkadot-js/notifications

Some configured endpoints are not available.

Check the nightly cron output (or via `yarn ci:chainEndpoints` locally) and disable the chains (either with `isDisabled` or `isUnreachable`) until the issue is resolved. The output as found from the test includes:

`Unorthodox @ wss://rpc.kusama.standard.tech Timeout connecting to wss://rpc.kusama.standard.tech`

`Standard  @ wss://rpc.westend.standard.tech Timeout connecting to wss://rpc.westend.standard.tech`

`MathChain @ wss://mathchain-asia.maiziqianbao.net/ws No DNS entry for mathchain-asia.maiziqianbao.net`

`MathChain @ wss://mathchain-us.maiziqianbao.net/ws Timeout connecting to wss://mathchain-us.maiziqianbao.net/ws`

issue.title: Add Support for ChargeAssetTxPayment
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [X] Feature request
  - [X] Support request
  - [] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

Currently, when constructing a transaction in `txwrapper-core` we create a type called `UnsignedTransaction` which extends `SignerPayloadJSON` from the `types` package in `polkadotjs/api` and contains all fields needed for a transaction. 


```
export interface SignerPayloadJSON {
    /**
     * @description The ss-58 encoded address
     */
    address: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint hash of the block, in hex
     */
    blockHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint block number, in hex
     */
    blockNumber: string;
    /**
     * @description The era for this transaction, in hex
     */
    era: string;
    /**
     * @description The genesis hash of the chain, in hex
     */
    genesisHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The encoded method (with arguments) in hex
     */
    method: string;
    /**
     * @description The nonce for this transaction, in hex
     */
    nonce: string;
    /**
     * @description The current spec version for the runtime
     */
    specVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The tip for this transaction, in hex
     */
    tip: string;
    /**
     * @description The current transaction version for the runtime
     */
    transactionVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The applicable signed extensions for this runtime
     */
    signedExtensions: string[];
    /**
     * @description The version of the extrinsic we are dealing with
     */
    version: number;
}
```
```
/**
 * JSON format for an unsigned transaction.
 */
export interface UnsignedTransaction extends SignerPayloadJSON {
  /**
  * The SCALE-encoded metadata, as a hex string. Can be retrieved via the RPC
  * call `state_getMetadata`.
  */
  metadataRpc: `0x${string}`;
  }
```

I would like to implement support for constructing a transaction using the signedExtension `ChargeAssetTxPayment`

```
/// Require the transactor pay for themselves and maybe include a tip to gain additional priority
/// in the queue. Allows paying via both `Currency` as well as `fungibles::Balanced`.
///
/// Wraps the transaction logic in [`pallet_transaction_payment`] and extends it with assets.
/// An asset id of `None` falls back to the underlying transaction payment via the native currency.
#[derive(Encode, Decode, Clone, Eq, PartialEq, TypeInfo)]
#[scale_info(skip_type_params(T))]
pub struct ChargeAssetTxPayment<T: Config> {
	#[codec(compact)]
	tip: BalanceOf<T>,
	asset_id: Option<ChargeAssetIdOf<T>>,
}
```

`ChargeAssetTxPayment` consists of an `asset_id` and a `tip`. `SignerPayloadJSON` doesn’t have an `assetId` field and therefore when constructing our `UnsignedTransaction` type we are currently unable to provide an `assetId` field/value in order to use the `ChargeAssetTxPayment` signedExtension.

We use the `UnsignedTransaction` when we create a signing payload:

```
export function createSigningPayload(
	unsigned: UnsignedTransaction,
	options: Options
): string {
	const { registry } = options;

	return registry
		.createType('ExtrinsicPayload', unsigned, {
			version: unsigned.version,
		})
		.toHex();
}
```
Here we also find that `GenericExtrinsicPayload` (which `ExtrinsicPayload` extends) doesn't support `assetId` and we'd like to add it:

```
export interface ExtrinsicPayloadValue {
  blockHash: AnyU8a;
  era: AnyU8a | IExtrinsicEra;
  genesisHash: AnyU8a;
  method: AnyU8a | IMethod<AnyTuple>;
  nonce: AnyNumber;
  specVersion: AnyNumber;
  tip: AnyNumber;
  transactionVersion: AnyNumber;
  assetId?: AnyNumber;
}
```

```
export declare class GenericExtrinsicPayload extends AbstractBase<ExtrinsicPayloadVx> {
    constructor(registry: Registry, value?: Partial<ExtrinsicPayloadValue> | Uint8Array | string, { version }?: ExtrinsicPayloadOptions);
    /**
     * @description The block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to (mortal/immortal)
     */
    get blockHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[ExtrinsicEra]]
     */
    get era(): GenericExtrinsicEra;
    /**
     * @description The genesis block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to
     */
    get genesisHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[Bytes]] contained in the payload
     */
    get method(): Bytes;
    /**
     * @description The [[Index]]
     */
    get nonce(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The specVersion as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get specVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description The [[Balance]]
     */
    get tip(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The transaction version as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get transactionVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description Compares the value of the input to see if there is a match
     */
    eq(other?: unknown): boolean;
    /**
     * @description Sign the payload with the keypair
     */
    sign(signerPair: IKeyringPair): {
        signature: HexString;
    };
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to to a human-friendly JSON, with additional fields, expansion and formatting of information
     */
    toHuman(isExtended?: boolean): AnyJson;
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to JSON, typically used for RPC transfers
     */
    toJSON(): any;
    /**
     * @description Returns the string representation of the value
     */
    toString(): string;
    /**
     * @description Returns a serialized u8a form
     */
    toU8a(isBare?: BareOpts): Uint8Array;
}
```


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

I would like to extend `SignerPayloadJSON` as well as the `GenericExtrinsicPayload` to support the optional `assetId` field/getter for the purpose of constructing transactions that use sufficient assets to pay for fees.

In order to do so and properly test changes alongside `txwrapper-core`, I would like to know if there is a recommended way of using our local `polkadotjs` as a dependency during our development?(linking our local `polkadotjs` to `txwrapper-core`).

In addition, what is the best way to add tests for these changes in `polkadotjs`?


* **Please tell us about your environment:**


  - Version:
  - Environment:

    - [X] Node.js
    - [ ] Browser
    - [ ] Other (limited support for other environments)

  - Language:

    - [ ] JavaScript
    - [X] TypeScript (tsc --version 4.8.3)
    - [ ] Other

comment.body: PS: Where there is a slight discrepancy (which can only be fixed by not using `Base`, but rather using `Enum` for the payload wrapper) is that it is not entirely obvious that `ExtrinsicPayload` is actually a versioned wrapper, the data really only sites on the inner, not the outer.

issue.title: Include Abstention vote for referenda in referenda tab (vote button) - OpenGov
issue.body:
With v9340 runtime upgrade, abstention vote was included: this allows token holders to note they see the proposal, and do not care to cast a vote in favour or against, **BUT the voting power is included on Support calculation** (good for curves thresholds) - it would be good to add this to the voting UI. 

https://hackmd.io/@otar/SykAgWmOo

issue.title: Remove persistent background pages (basically eol in Chrome)
issue.body:
Specifically https://github.com/polkadot-js/extension/blob/master/packages/extension/manifest.json#L11

This puts the extension down the road to get ready for a move to V3 manifests (persistent not supported, background pages are service workers)

There is an impact on initialization, so will see what the overhead turns out to be. (Specifically wasm-crypto)

This also means that the in-memory state needs to be moved to actual storage as applicable.

The checklist -

https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/mv3-migration-checklist/

comment.body:
Have a working local version that I've been using and sorting through issues (of which there were "some", not even mentioning dual FF & Chrome support), but there also seems some breathing room atm - https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33925735. Keeping an eye since it may just be enough tracking the FF rollouts of support.

TL;DR Some breathing room is nice since FF + Chrome compat is "slightly" nightmarish...

issue.title: Unavailable chain endpoints
issue.body:
cc @polkadot-js/notifications

Some configured endpoints are not available.

Check the nightly cron output (or via `yarn ci:chainEndpoints` locally) and disable the chains (either with `isDisabled` or `isUnreachable`) until the issue is resolved. The output as found from the test includes:

`Unorthodox @ wss://rpc.kusama.standard.tech Timeout connecting to wss://rpc.kusama.standard.tech`

`Standard  @ wss://rpc.westend.standard.tech Timeout connecting to wss://rpc.westend.standard.tech`

`MathChain @ wss://mathchain-asia.maiziqianbao.net/ws No DNS entry for mathchain-asia.maiziqianbao.net`

`MathChain @ wss://mathchain-us.maiziqianbao.net/ws Timeout connecting to wss://mathchain-us.maiziqianbao.net/ws`

repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [X] Feature request
  - [X] Support request
  - [] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

Currently, when constructing a transaction in `txwrapper-core` we create a type called `UnsignedTransaction` which extends `SignerPayloadJSON` from the `types` package in `polkadotjs/api` and contains all fields needed for a transaction. 


```
export interface SignerPayloadJSON {
    /**
     * @description The ss-58 encoded address
     */
    address: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint hash of the block, in hex
     */
    blockHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint block number, in hex
     */
    blockNumber: string;
    /**
     * @description The era for this transaction, in hex
     */
    era: string;
    /**
     * @description The genesis hash of the chain, in hex
     */
    genesisHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The encoded method (with arguments) in hex
     */
    method: string;
    /**
     * @description The nonce for this transaction, in hex
     */
    nonce: string;
    /**
     * @description The current spec version for the runtime
     */
    specVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The tip for this transaction, in hex
     */
    tip: string;
    /**
     * @description The current transaction version for the runtime
     */
    transactionVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The applicable signed extensions for this runtime
     */
    signedExtensions: string[];
    /**
     * @description The version of the extrinsic we are dealing with
     */
    version: number;
}
```
```
/**
 * JSON format for an unsigned transaction.
 */
export interface UnsignedTransaction extends SignerPayloadJSON {
  /**
  * The SCALE-encoded metadata, as a hex string. Can be retrieved via the RPC
  * call `state_getMetadata`.
  */
  metadataRpc: `0x${string}`;
  }
```

I would like to implement support for constructing a transaction using the signedExtension `ChargeAssetTxPayment`

```
/// Require the transactor pay for themselves and maybe include a tip to gain additional priority
/// in the queue. Allows paying via both `Currency` as well as `fungibles::Balanced`.
///
/// Wraps the transaction logic in [`pallet_transaction_payment`] and extends it with assets.
/// An asset id of `None` falls back to the underlying transaction payment via the native currency.
#[derive(Encode, Decode, Clone, Eq, PartialEq, TypeInfo)]
#[scale_info(skip_type_params(T))]
pub struct ChargeAssetTxPayment<T: Config> {
	#[codec(compact)]
	tip: BalanceOf<T>,
	asset_id: Option<ChargeAssetIdOf<T>>,
}
```

`ChargeAssetTxPayment` consists of an `asset_id` and a `tip`. `SignerPayloadJSON` doesn’t have an `assetId` field and therefore when constructing our `UnsignedTransaction` type we are currently unable to provide an `assetId` field/value in order to use the `ChargeAssetTxPayment` signedExtension.

We use the `UnsignedTransaction` when we create a signing payload:

```
export function createSigningPayload(
	unsigned: UnsignedTransaction,
	options: Options
): string {
	const { registry } = options;

	return registry
		.createType('ExtrinsicPayload', unsigned, {
			version: unsigned.version,
		})
		.toHex();
}
```
Here we also find that `GenericExtrinsicPayload` (which `ExtrinsicPayload` extends) doesn't support `assetId` and we'd like to add it:

```
export interface ExtrinsicPayloadValue {
  blockHash: AnyU8a;
  era: AnyU8a | IExtrinsicEra;
  genesisHash: AnyU8a;
  method: AnyU8a | IMethod<AnyTuple>;
  nonce: AnyNumber;
  specVersion: AnyNumber;
  tip: AnyNumber;
  transactionVersion: AnyNumber;
  assetId?: AnyNumber;
}
```

```
export declare class GenericExtrinsicPayload extends AbstractBase<ExtrinsicPayloadVx> {
    constructor(registry: Registry, value?: Partial<ExtrinsicPayloadValue> | Uint8Array | string, { version }?: ExtrinsicPayloadOptions);
    /**
     * @description The block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to (mortal/immortal)
     */
    get blockHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[ExtrinsicEra]]
     */
    get era(): GenericExtrinsicEra;
    /**
     * @description The genesis block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to
     */
    get genesisHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[Bytes]] contained in the payload
     */
    get method(): Bytes;
    /**
     * @description The [[Index]]
     */
    get nonce(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The specVersion as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get specVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description The [[Balance]]
     */
    get tip(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The transaction version as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get transactionVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description Compares the value of the input to see if there is a match
     */
    eq(other?: unknown): boolean;
    /**
     * @description Sign the payload with the keypair
     */
    sign(signerPair: IKeyringPair): {
        signature: HexString;
    };
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to to a human-friendly JSON, with additional fields, expansion and formatting of information
     */
    toHuman(isExtended?: boolean): AnyJson;
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to JSON, typically used for RPC transfers
     */
    toJSON(): any;
    /**
     * @description Returns the string representation of the value
     */
    toString(): string;
    /**
     * @description Returns a serialized u8a form
     */
    toU8a(isBare?: BareOpts): Uint8Array;
}
```


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

I would like to extend `SignerPayloadJSON` as well as the `GenericExtrinsicPayload` to support the optional `assetId` field/getter for the purpose of constructing transactions that use sufficient assets to pay for fees.

In order to do so and properly test changes alongside `txwrapper-core`, I would like to know if there is a recommended way of using our local `polkadotjs` as a dependency during our development?(linking our local `polkadotjs` to `txwrapper-core`).

In addition, what is the best way to add tests for these changes in `polkadotjs`?


* **Please tell us about your environment:**


  - Version:
  - Environment:

    - [X] Node.js
    - [ ] Browser
    - [ ] Other (limited support for other environments)

  - Language:

    - [ ] JavaScript
    - [X] TypeScript (tsc --version 4.8.3)
    - [ ] Other

comment.body: PS: Where there is a slight discrepancy (which can only be fixed by not using `Base`, but rather using `Enum` for the payload wrapper) is that it is not entirely obvious that `ExtrinsicPayload` is actually a versioned wrapper, the data really only sites on the inner, not the outer.

issue.title: Include Abstention vote for referenda in referenda tab (vote button) - OpenGov
issue.body:
With v9340 runtime upgrade, abstention vote was included: this allows token holders to note they see the proposal, and do not care to cast a vote in favour or against, **BUT the voting power is included on Support calculation** (good for curves thresholds) - it would be good to add this to the voting UI. 

https://hackmd.io/@otar/SykAgWmOo

issue.title: Remove persistent background pages (basically eol in Chrome)
issue.body:
Specifically https://github.com/polkadot-js/extension/blob/master/packages/extension/manifest.json#L11

This puts the extension down the road to get ready for a move to V3 manifests (persistent not supported, background pages are service workers)

There is an impact on initialization, so will see what the overhead turns out to be. (Specifically wasm-crypto)

This also means that the in-memory state needs to be moved to actual storage as applicable.

The checklist -

https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/mv3-migration-checklist/

comment.body:
Have a working local version that I've been using and sorting through issues (of which there were "some", not even mentioning dual FF & Chrome support), but there also seems some breathing room atm - https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33925735. Keeping an eye since it may just be enough tracking the FF rollouts of support.

TL;DR Some breathing room is nice since FF + Chrome compat is "slightly" nightmarish...

issue.title: Unavailable chain endpoints
issue.body:
cc @polkadot-js/notifications

Some configured endpoints are not available.

Check the nightly cron output (or via `yarn ci:chainEndpoints` locally) and disable the chains (either with `isDisabled` or `isUnreachable`) until the issue is resolved. The output as found from the test includes:

`Unorthodox @ wss://rpc.kusama.standard.tech Timeout connecting to wss://rpc.kusama.standard.tech`

`Standard  @ wss://rpc.westend.standard.tech Timeout connecting to wss://rpc.westend.standard.tech`

`MathChain @ wss://mathchain-asia.maiziqianbao.net/ws No DNS entry for mathchain-asia.maiziqianbao.net`

`MathChain @ wss://mathchain-us.maiziqianbao.net/ws Timeout connecting to wss://mathchain-us.maiziqianbao.net/ws`

issue.title: Add Support for ChargeAssetTxPayment
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [X] Feature request
  - [X] Support request
  - [] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

Currently, when constructing a transaction in `txwrapper-core` we create a type called `UnsignedTransaction` which extends `SignerPayloadJSON` from the `types` package in `polkadotjs/api` and contains all fields needed for a transaction. 


```
export interface SignerPayloadJSON {
    /**
     * @description The ss-58 encoded address
     */
    address: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint hash of the block, in hex
     */
    blockHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint block number, in hex
     */
    blockNumber: string;
    /**
     * @description The era for this transaction, in hex
     */
    era: string;
    /**
     * @description The genesis hash of the chain, in hex
     */
    genesisHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The encoded method (with arguments) in hex
     */
    method: string;
    /**
     * @description The nonce for this transaction, in hex
     */
    nonce: string;
    /**
     * @description The current spec version for the runtime
     */
    specVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The tip for this transaction, in hex
     */
    tip: string;
    /**
     * @description The current transaction version for the runtime
     */
    transactionVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The applicable signed extensions for this runtime
     */
    signedExtensions: string[];
    /**
     * @description The version of the extrinsic we are dealing with
     */
    version: number;
}
```
```
/**
 * JSON format for an unsigned transaction.
 */
export interface UnsignedTransaction extends SignerPayloadJSON {
  /**
  * The SCALE-encoded metadata, as a hex string. Can be retrieved via the RPC
  * call `state_getMetadata`.
  */
  metadataRpc: `0x${string}`;
  }
```

I would like to implement support for constructing a transaction using the signedExtension `ChargeAssetTxPayment`

```
/// Require the transactor pay for themselves and maybe include a tip to gain additional priority
/// in the queue. Allows paying via both `Currency` as well as `fungibles::Balanced`.
///
/// Wraps the transaction logic in [`pallet_transaction_payment`] and extends it with assets.
/// An asset id of `None` falls back to the underlying transaction payment via the native currency.
#[derive(Encode, Decode, Clone, Eq, PartialEq, TypeInfo)]
#[scale_info(skip_type_params(T))]
pub struct ChargeAssetTxPayment<T: Config> {
	#[codec(compact)]
	tip: BalanceOf<T>,
	asset_id: Option<ChargeAssetIdOf<T>>,
}
```

`ChargeAssetTxPayment` consists of an `asset_id` and a `tip`. `SignerPayloadJSON` doesn’t have an `assetId` field and therefore when constructing our `UnsignedTransaction` type we are currently unable to provide an `assetId` field/value in order to use the `ChargeAssetTxPayment` signedExtension.

We use the `UnsignedTransaction` when we create a signing payload:

```
export function createSigningPayload(
	unsigned: UnsignedTransaction,
	options: Options
): string {
	const { registry } = options;

	return registry
		.createType('ExtrinsicPayload', unsigned, {
			version: unsigned.version,
		})
		.toHex();
}
```
Here we also find that `GenericExtrinsicPayload` (which `ExtrinsicPayload` extends) doesn't support `assetId` and we'd like to add it:

```
export interface ExtrinsicPayloadValue {
  blockHash: AnyU8a;
  era: AnyU8a | IExtrinsicEra;
  genesisHash: AnyU8a;
  method: AnyU8a | IMethod<AnyTuple>;
  nonce: AnyNumber;
  specVersion: AnyNumber;
  tip: AnyNumber;
  transactionVersion: AnyNumber;
  assetId?: AnyNumber;
}
```

```
export declare class GenericExtrinsicPayload extends AbstractBase<ExtrinsicPayloadVx> {
    constructor(registry: Registry, value?: Partial<ExtrinsicPayloadValue> | Uint8Array | string, { version }?: ExtrinsicPayloadOptions);
    /**
     * @description The block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to (mortal/immortal)
     */
    get blockHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[ExtrinsicEra]]
     */
    get era(): GenericExtrinsicEra;
    /**
     * @description The genesis block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to
     */
    get genesisHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[Bytes]] contained in the payload
     */
    get method(): Bytes;
    /**
     * @description The [[Index]]
     */
    get nonce(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The specVersion as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get specVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description The [[Balance]]
     */
    get tip(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The transaction version as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get transactionVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description Compares the value of the input to see if there is a match
     */
    eq(other?: unknown): boolean;
    /**
     * @description Sign the payload with the keypair
     */
    sign(signerPair: IKeyringPair): {
        signature: HexString;
    };
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to to a human-friendly JSON, with additional fields, expansion and formatting of information
     */
    toHuman(isExtended?: boolean): AnyJson;
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to JSON, typically used for RPC transfers
     */
    toJSON(): any;
    /**
     * @description Returns the string representation of the value
     */
    toString(): string;
    /**
     * @description Returns a serialized u8a form
     */
    toU8a(isBare?: BareOpts): Uint8Array;
}
```


* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

I would like to extend `SignerPayloadJSON` as well as the `GenericExtrinsicPayload` to support the optional `assetId` field/getter for the purpose of constructing transactions that use sufficient assets to pay for fees.

In order to do so and properly test changes alongside `txwrapper-core`, I would like to know if there is a recommended way of using our local `polkadotjs` as a dependency during our development?(linking our local `polkadotjs` to `txwrapper-core`).

In addition, what is the best way to add tests for these changes in `polkadotjs`?


* **Please tell us about your environment:**


  - Version:
  - Environment:

    - [X] Node.js
    - [ ] Browser
    - [ ] Other (limited support for other environments)

  - Language:

    - [ ] JavaScript
    - [X] TypeScript (tsc --version 4.8.3)
    - [ ] Other

comment.body: PS: Where there is a slight discrepancy (which can only be fixed by not using `Base`, but rather using `Enum` for the payload wrapper) is that it is not entirely obvious that `ExtrinsicPayload` is actually a versioned wrapper, the data really only sites on the inner, not the outer.

issue.title: Add Support for ChargeAssetTxPayment
issue.body:
<!--

For general support, howto, coding and bundling questions, please
use the Substrate & Polkadot StackExchange at

  https://substrate.stackexchange.com/

and get other ecosystem developers involved. This issues in this
repository are meant for the tracking of feature requests and bug
reports.

While all issues are looked at non-bug and non-features would take
quite a bit longer to get to and may yield less than satisfactory
responses in this format.

Additionally, please ensure you have done a search on the existing
and closed issues before logging a new request. This saves time on
all sides.

-->


* **I'm submitting a ...**

  - [ ] Bug report
  - [X] Feature request
  - [X] Support request
  - [] Other


* **What is the current behavior and expected behavior?**

Currently, when constructing a transaction in `txwrapper-core` we create a type called `UnsignedTransaction` which extends `SignerPayloadJSON` from the `types` package in `polkadotjs/api` and contains all fields needed for a transaction. 


```
export interface SignerPayloadJSON {
    /**
     * @description The ss-58 encoded address
     */
    address: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint hash of the block, in hex
     */
    blockHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The checkpoint block number, in hex
     */
    blockNumber: string;
    /**
     * @description The era for this transaction, in hex
     */
    era: string;
    /**
     * @description The genesis hash of the chain, in hex
     */
    genesisHash: string;
    /**
     * @description The encoded method (with arguments) in hex
     */
    method: string;
    /**
     * @description The nonce for this transaction, in hex
     */
    nonce: string;
    /**
     * @description The current spec version for the runtime
     */
    specVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The tip for this transaction, in hex
     */
    tip: string;
    /**
     * @description The current transaction version for the runtime
     */
    transactionVersion: string;
    /**
     * @description The applicable signed extensions for this runtime
     */
    signedExtensions: string[];
    /**
     * @description The version of the extrinsic we are dealing with
     */
    version: number;
}
```
```
/**
 * JSON format for an unsigned transaction.
 */
export interface UnsignedTransaction extends SignerPayloadJSON {
  /**
  * The SCALE-encoded metadata, as a hex string. Can be retrieved via the RPC
  * call `state_getMetadata`.
  */

  }
```

I would like to implement support for constructing a transaction using the signedExtension `ChargeAssetTxPayment`

```

/// in the queue. Allows paying via both `Currency` as well as `fungibles::Balanced`.

#[scale_info(skip_type_params(T))]
pub struct ChargeAssetTxPayment<T: Config> {
	#[codec(compact)]
	tip: BalanceOf<T>,
	asset_id: Option<ChargeAssetIdOf<T>>,
}
```

`ChargeAssetTxPayment` consists of an `asset_id` and a `tip`. `SignerPayloadJSON` doesn’t have an `assetId` field and therefore when constructing our `UnsignedTransaction` type we are currently unable to provide an `assetId` field/value in order to use the `ChargeAssetTxPayment` signedExtension.

We use the `UnsignedTransaction` when we create a signing payload:

```
export function createSigningPayload(
	unsigned: UnsignedTransaction,
	options: Options
): string {
	const { registry } = options;

	return registry
		.createType('ExtrinsicPayload', unsigned, {
			version: unsigned.version,
		})
		.toHex();
}
```
Here we also find that `GenericExtrinsicPayload` (which `ExtrinsicPayload` extends) doesn't support `assetId` and we'd like to add it:

```
export interface ExtrinsicPayloadValue {
  blockHash: AnyU8a;
  era: AnyU8a | IExtrinsicEra;
  genesisHash: AnyU8a;
  method: AnyU8a | IMethod<AnyTuple>;
  nonce: AnyNumber;
  specVersion: AnyNumber;
  tip: AnyNumber;
  transactionVersion: AnyNumber;
  assetId?: AnyNumber;
}
```

```
export declare class GenericExtrinsicPayload extends AbstractBase<ExtrinsicPayloadVx> {
    constructor(registry: Registry, value?: Partial<ExtrinsicPayloadValue> | Uint8Array | string, { version }?: ExtrinsicPayloadOptions);
    /**
     * @description The block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to (mortal/immortal)
     */
    get blockHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[ExtrinsicEra]]
     */
    get era(): GenericExtrinsicEra;
    /**
     * @description The genesis block [[BlockHash]] the signature applies to
     */
    get genesisHash(): BlockHash;
    /**
     * @description The [[Bytes]] contained in the payload
     */
    get method(): Bytes;
    /**
     * @description The [[Index]]
     */
    get nonce(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The specVersion as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get specVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description The [[Balance]]
     */
    get tip(): ICompact<INumber>;
    /**
     * @description The transaction version as a [[u32]] for this payload
     */
    get transactionVersion(): INumber;
    /**
     * @description Compares the value of the input to see if there is a match
     */
    eq(other?: unknown): boolean;
    /**
     * @description Sign the payload with the keypair
     */
    sign(signerPair: IKeyringPair): {
        signature: HexString;
    };
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to to a human-friendly JSON, with additional fields, expansion and formatting of information
     */
    toHuman(isExtended?: boolean): AnyJson;
    /**
     * @description Converts the Object to JSON, typically used for RPC transfers
     */
    toJSON(): any;
    /**

* **What is the motivation for changing the behavior?**

In order to do so and properly test changes alongside `txwrapper-core`, I would like to know if there is a recommended way of using our local `polkadotjs` as a dependency during our development?(linking our local `polkadotjs` to `txwrapper-core`).
